title: Task-Centered Second Language Learning Program Based on Extended Reality (XR) and Artificial Intelligence (AI)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic second-language grammar and vocabulary understanding, along with digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: Job-integrated language education program for current elementary education practitioners, operated in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment, with project-based assessments measuring learning outcomes.

learning_goals: At the end of the mid-term course (4 weeks), learners can communicate with at least 80% accuracy in the target language (L2) in seven or more out of ten everyday situations (shopping, hospital visits, public transportation use, etc.).

Learners analyze three language use scenarios reflecting intercultural understanding in XR environments (e.g., VR cultural experience platforms) and write at least two dialogues per scenario considering cultural context, achieving an "excellent" rating in at least two out of three peer-assessment rubric items (cultural appropriateness, linguistic accuracy, creativity).
Development of adaptive capacity to receive personalized language feedback through interaction with AI-based conversational agents.

Learners, in groups of three, establish two language teaching strategies applicable to three types of real classroom situations (e.g., grammar explanation, role-play, feedback provision) and achieve an average score of at least 4 (on a 5-point scale) in peer assessments and instructor feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
